capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed an adult, and I've had my fair share of dealing with him in the Hogwarts years. He's a complex character, to say the least.

Snape is an adult, and I have to admit, his age has played a significant role in shaping my perception of him as a character. He's always been portrayed as this complex, multifaceted individual, and his age seems to be a big part of that. It's interesting to see how J.K. Rowling used his age to explore themes of maturity, wisdom, and the weight of experience.
